title: Interface for Google Gemini API
text: R package use Google’s gemini via API R

title: Interface for Google Gemini API
code: install.packages("gemini.R")

title: Interface for Google Gemini API
code: install.packages("gemini.R",   repos = c("https://jhk0530.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org") )

title: Interface for Google Gemini API
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("jhk0530/gemini.R")

previous_headings: Usage > Gemini with AI Studio API
title: Interface for Google Gemini API
code: library(gemini.R)  setAPI("your API key") # check https://makersuite.google.com/app/apikey gemini("Explain about the gemini in astrology in one line")  # text  # "Gemini, the third astrological sign, is associated with  # communication, adaptability, and a thirst for knowledge."

previous_headings: Usage > Gemini with AI Studio API
title: Interface for Google Gemini API
code: # uses default prompt as "Explain this image" # uses included image of gemini.R package gemini_image(image = system.file("docs/reference/figures/image.png", package = "gemini.R"))  # text  # " The image shows a table with a white tablecloth. On the table are two cups of coffee,  # a bowl of blueberries, and five scones. The scones are covered in blueberries and have  # a crumbly texture. There are also some pink flowers on the table. The background is a  # dark blue color. The image is taken from a top-down perspective."

previous_headings: Usage > Gemini with AI Studio API
title: Interface for Google Gemini API
code: # use default prompt as "Describe this audio" # uses included audio of gemini.R package gemini_audio(audio = system.file("docs/reference/helloworld.mp3", package = "gemini.R"))  # text # "The audio contains a clear, crisp recording of a person saying \"Hello world\".   # Following the phrase is a distinct, repeated percussive sound, possibly a rhythmic  # tapping or clicking noise. The sound is consistent and mechanical in nature.\n"

previous_headings: Usage > Gemini with AI Studio API
title: Interface for Google Gemini API
text: use gemini_image function, image file required. recommend use shiny app fileInput function.
code: library(shiny) library(gemini.R)  setAPI("YOUR KEY") ui <- fluidPage(   sidebarLayout(     NULL,     mainPanel(       fileInput(         inputId = "file",         label = "Choose file to upload",       ),       imageOutput(outputId = "image1"),       textInput(         inputId = "prompt",          label = "Prompt",          placeholder = "Enter Prompts Here"       ),       actionButton("goButton", "Ask to gemini"),       textOutput("text1")     )   ) )  server <- function(input, output) {      observeEvent(input$file, {     path <- input$file$datapath     output$image1 <- renderImage({       list(         src = path       )     }, deleteFile = FALSE)   })      observeEvent(input$goButton, {     output$text1 <- renderText({       gemini_image(input$prompt, input$file$datapath)     })   }) }  shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)

previous_headings: Usage > Gemini with Vertex AI API
title: Interface for Google Gemini API
code: tokens <- token.vertex("YOUR_API_KEY.json", model_id = "1.5-flash") prompt <- "What is sachins Jersy number?"  gemini.vertex(prompt, tokens)

title: Interface for Google Gemini API
code: tokens <- token.vertex("YOUR_API_KEY.json", model_id = "1.5-flash")  gemini_image.vertex(image = "YOUR_IMAGE.png", type, tokens)

previous_headings: Usage > Gemini with Vertex AI API
title: Interface for Google Gemini API
text: File upload Google Cloud using API supported. Instead must use uploaded file. (e.g. Google Cloud Storage) Example sound soundbible
code: tokens <- token.vertex("YOUR_API_KEY.json", model_id = "1.5-flash")  gemini_audio.vertex(audio = "YOUR_AUDIO.mp3", tokens)

title: Interface for Google Gemini API
text: may customize keyboard shortcut feature.

title: Interface for Google Gemini API
text: use API, recommend check least following. Google Cloud Platform Terms Service Gemini API Additional Terms Service may terms conditions need check. app uses API compliant Google Terms Service. [!note] image Google AI Developers ’ve got many inspiration Deepanshu Bhalla’s article

what: Generate text from text with Gemini — gemini
title: Generate text from text with Gemini — gemini
text: Generate text text Gemini

title: Generate text from text with Gemini — gemini
code: gemini(prompt, model = "1.5-flash", temperature = 0.5, maxOutputTokens = 1024)

title: Generate text from text with Gemini — gemini
text: prompt prompt generate text model model use. Options '1.5-flash', '1.5-pro', '1.0-pro' '2.0-flash-exp'. Default '1.5-flash' see https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/models/gemini temperature temperature use. Default 0.5 value 0 2 see https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/models/generative-models#model-parameters maxOutputTokens maximum number tokens generate. Default 1024 100 tokens correspond roughly 60-80 words.

title: Generate text from text with Gemini — gemini
text: Generated text

title: Generate text from text with Gemini — gemini
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(gemini.R) setAPI("YOUR_API_KEY") gemini("Explain dplyr's mutate function") } # }

what: Generate text from text with Gemini Vertex API — gemini.vertex
title: Generate text from text with Gemini Vertex API — gemini.vertex
text: Generate text text Gemini Vertex API

title: Generate text from text with Gemini Vertex API — gemini.vertex
code: gemini.vertex(prompt = NULL, tokens = NULL)

title: Generate text from text with Gemini Vertex API — gemini.vertex
text: prompt character string containing prompt Gemini model. tokens list containing API URL key token.vertex() function.

title: Generate text from text with Gemini Vertex API — gemini.vertex
text: #' character string containing generated text.

title: Generate text from text with Gemini Vertex API — gemini.vertex
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # token should be created before this. using the token.vertex() function prompt <- "What is sachins Jersey number?" gemini.vertex(prompt, tokens) } # }

title: Analyze audio using Gemini — gemini_audio
text: function sends audio Gemini API returns text description.

title: Analyze audio using Gemini — gemini_audio
code: gemini_audio(   audio = NULL,   prompt = "Describe this audio",   model = "1.5-flash",   temperature = 0.5,   maxOutputTokens = 1024 )

title: Analyze audio using Gemini — gemini_audio
text: audio Path audio file (default: uses sample file).  Must MP3. prompt string describing audio. model Gemini model use ("1.5-flash" "1.5-pro", "2.0-flash-exp"). Defaults "1.5-flash". temperature Controls randomness generated text (0-2).  Defaults 0.5. maxOutputTokens maximum number tokens generated text. Defaults 1024.

title: Analyze audio using Gemini — gemini_audio
text: character vector containing Gemini API's response.

title: Analyze audio using Gemini — gemini_audio
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(gemini.R) setAPI("YOUR_API_KEY") gemini_image(audio = system.file("docs/reference/helloworld.mp3", package = "gemini.R")) } # }

what: Analyze Audio using Gemini Vertex API — gemini_audio.vertex
title: Analyze Audio using Gemini Vertex API — gemini_audio.vertex
text: function sends audio Gemini API returns text description.

title: Analyze Audio using Gemini Vertex API — gemini_audio.vertex
code: gemini_audio.vertex(   audio = NULL,   prompt = "Describe this audio",   tokens = NULL )

title: Analyze Audio using Gemini Vertex API — gemini_audio.vertex
text: audio Path audio file (character string). supports "mp3". prompt prompt guide Gemini API's analysis (character string, defaults "Describe audio"). tokens list containing API URL key token.vertex() function.

title: Analyze Audio using Gemini Vertex API — gemini_audio.vertex
text: character vector containing Gemini API's description audio.

title: Multi-turn conversations (chat) — gemini_chat
text: Generate text text Gemini

title: Multi-turn conversations (chat) — gemini_chat
code: gemini_chat(   prompt,   history = list(),   model = "1.5-flash",   temperature = 0.5,   maxOutputTokens = 1024 )

title: Multi-turn conversations (chat) — gemini_chat
text: prompt prompt generate text history history object keep track conversation model model use. Options '1.5-flash', '1.5-pro', '1.0-pro' '2.0-flash-exp'. Default '1.5-flash' see https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/models/gemini temperature temperature use. Default 0.5 value 0 2 see https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/models/generative-models#model-parameters maxOutputTokens maximum number tokens generate. Default 1024 100 tokens correspond roughly 60-80 words.

title: Multi-turn conversations (chat) — gemini_chat
text: Generated text

title: Multi-turn conversations (chat) — gemini_chat
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(gemini.R) setAPI("YOUR_API_KEY")  chats <- gemini_chat("Pretend you're a snowman and stay in character for each") print(chats$outputs)  chats <- gemini_chat("What's your favorite season of the year?", chats$history) print(chats$outputs)  chats <- gemini_chat("How do you think about summer?", chats$history) print(chats$outputs) } # }

what: Generate text from text and image with Gemini — gemini_image
title: Generate text from text and image with Gemini — gemini_image
text: Generate text text image Gemini

title: Generate text from text and image with Gemini — gemini_image
code: gemini_image(   image = NULL,   prompt = "Explain this image",   model = "1.5-flash",   temperature = 0.5,   maxOutputTokens = 1024,   type = "png" )

title: Generate text from text and image with Gemini — gemini_image
text: image image generate text prompt prompt generate text, Default "Explain image" model model use. Options '1.5-flash', '1.5-pro' '2.0-flash-exp'. Default '1.5-flash' see https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/models/gemini temperature temperature use. Default 0.5 value 0 2 see https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/models/generative-models#model-parameters maxOutputTokens maximum number tokens generate. Default 1024 100 tokens correspond roughly 60-80 words. type type image. Options 'png', 'jpeg', 'webp', 'heic', 'heif'. Default 'png'

title: Generate text from text and image with Gemini — gemini_image
text: Generated text

title: Generate text from text and image with Gemini — gemini_image
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(gemini.R) setAPI("YOUR_API_KEY") gemini_image(image = system.file("docs/reference/figures/image.png", package = "gemini.R")) } # }

what: Generate text from text and image with Gemini Vertex API — gemini_image.vertex
title: Generate text from text and image with Gemini Vertex API — gemini_image.vertex
text: Generate text text image Gemini Vertex API

title: Generate text from text and image with Gemini Vertex API — gemini_image.vertex
code: gemini_image.vertex(   image = NULL,   prompt = "Explain this image",   type = "png",   tokens = NULL )

title: Generate text from text and image with Gemini Vertex API — gemini_image.vertex
text: image image generate text prompt character string specifying prompt use image. Defaults "Explain image".  Currently ignored. type character string specifying image type ("png", "jpeg", "webp", "heic", "heif"). Defaults "png". tokens list containing API URL key token.vertex() function.

title: Generate text from text and image with Gemini Vertex API — gemini_image.vertex
text: character string containing Gemini's description image.

title: Generate Roxygen Documentation — gen_docs
text: Generates Roxygen2 documentation R function based currently selected code.

title: Generate Roxygen Documentation — gen_docs
code: gen_docs(prompt = NULL)

title: Generate Roxygen Documentation — gen_docs
text: prompt character string specifying additional instructions LLM.  Defaults prompt requesting Roxygen2 documentation without original code.

title: Generate Roxygen Documentation — gen_docs
text: character string containing generated Roxygen2 documentation.

what: Generates unit test code for an R function. — gen_tests
title: Generates unit test code for an R function. — gen_tests
text: Generates unit test code R function.

title: Generates unit test code for an R function. — gen_tests
code: gen_tests(prompt = NULL)

title: Generates unit test code for an R function. — gen_tests
text: prompt character string specifying prompt Gemini model.  NULL, default prompt used.

title: Generates unit test code for an R function. — gen_tests
text: #' character string containing generated unit test code.

text: Set API key environment variable

code: setAPI(api_key)

title: Set API key — setAPI
text: api_key API key set

title: Set API key — setAPI
text: return value, called side effects.

title: Set API key — setAPI
text: Please aware agree terms service API provider. app uses API key subject terms service. Also, please aware API key sensitive information.

title: Set API key — setAPI
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ setAPI("my_api_key") } # }

what: Generate Gemini Access Token and Endpoint URL — token.vertex
title: Generate Gemini Access Token and Endpoint URL — token.vertex
text: Generates access token Gemini model constructs corresponding endpoint URL.

title: Generate Gemini Access Token and Endpoint URL — token.vertex
code: token.vertex(jsonkey = NULL, model_id = NULL, expTime = 3600)

title: Generate Gemini Access Token and Endpoint URL — token.vertex
text: jsonkey path JSON file containing service account key Vertex AI. model_id ID Gemini model. prepended "gemini-". expTime expiration time access token seconds (default 3600 seconds, 1 hour).

title: Generate Gemini Access Token and Endpoint URL — token.vertex
text: list containing: key generated access token. url endpoint URL Gemini model.

title: Generate Gemini Access Token and Endpoint URL — token.vertex
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(gemini.R) tokens <- token.vertex(jsonkey = "YOURAPIKEY.json", model_id = "1.5-flash")  } # }

title: gemini.R 0.8.0
text: Add Vertex AI new functions: token.vertex(), gemini.vertex(), gemini_image.vertex(), gemini_audio.vertex() functions experimental stage may change future versions.

title: gemini.R 0.8.0
text: Generate unit test using gen_test() added. gemini_audio supports mp3. gemini.R supports 2.0-flash-exp model.

title: gemini.R 0.8.0
text: Generate roxygen gen_docs() added. terms improved.

title: gemini.R 0.8.0
text: gemini.R supports 1.5=flash model. gemini functions require temperature, maxTokenOutput

title: gemini.R 0.8.0
text: Updated use httr2 setAPI now shows last 4 words API key confirmation. cat updated using cli better readability console. gemini_image() takes default prompt “Explain image” example image flower. See ?gemini_image

title: gemini.R 0.8.0
text: R CMD CHECK longer shows NOTEs WARNINGs. use R-hub check multiple platforms github action

title: gemini.R 0.8.0
text: Added Multi-turn conversation Chat 💬. See gemini_chat Slight change function documentation. Now generates message inform setAPI API key exist yet.
